div.h1: Welcome to SAU 15 – Auburn, Candia, Hooksett
div.div: SAU #15 school districts believe the roots of a great community lie in the strength of the educational system that molds today’s children into tomorrow’s leaders. Our schools are child centered and provide high-quality, rigorous instruction that engages and challenges students in acquiring the knowledge, skills, and strategies necessary for the 21st century.

header.h2: Welcome to SAU 15 – Auburn, Candia, Hooksett

h2.a: Governor Extends Distance Learning Until End of School Year

li.p:
March 26, 2020
Dear Auburn, Candia and Hooksett Families;
Today, as many of you may have heard, Governor Sununu issued a stay-at-home order and extended distance learning until Monday, May 4, 2020. When we made the move to remote learning on March 16, 2020, we did so, hoping that three weeks would be sufficient to support community efforts to slow the spread of the COVID-19 virus. It is clear that these efforts need to be more long-term to make a meaningful impact.
As teachers have been implementing distance learning for the past two weeks, we have also been planning for distance learning to continue...

Today, Governor Chris Sununu closed all New Hampshire schools until April 3, 2020. Additional communication regarding this new development will be forthcoming.
Distance Learning (Day 1) will begin tomorrow, March 16, 2020, as planned.

h2.a: AUBURN SCHOOL BOARD PUBLIC MEETING NOTICE

li.p:
Emergency Remote Meeting TUESDAY, APRIL 14, 2020 6:00 P.M.
The Auburn School Board will be holding a remote meeting via ZOOM on Tuesday, April 14, 2020, commencing at 6:00 p.m.
ZOOM will be the platform used to run the meeting for the Board. It can be accessed by doing the following:

br.h3: Candia School DistrictView All posts from Candia School District

li.p: Today is day 13 of distance learning. You all should have received an email from me last night outlining the changes to our distance learning platform that will take place beginning Monday, April 6th. Please note that this is also the start of a new quarter for our unified arts...

Do you want your name on the street sign driving up to Cawley Middle School? On Thursday, February 5 tickets can be purchased for the "Name the Street Sign Raffle" during during lunches or purchased online at https://hooksettpta.org/products/cawley-street-sign-raffle.
Tickets are 10 for $5.00 or 25 for $10.00 as...

February 17 to February 21, 2020
This week HMS is celebrating our current, new, and future friendships!
Monday, February 17- Support our Military Day!
Support our military friends by wearing military colors or red, white, and blue. Throughout the week we will be collecting items for donations, a list will be provided.
Tuesday,...

h2.a: Read Across America & Dr. Seuss Theme Week

li.p: The week we come back from vacation, children across America will be celebrating the birthday of Ted Geisel, better known as Dr. Seuss. In honor of this literary great, we will join in the festivities by reading a Dr. Seuss book each day at school. At home, you can help...
